CARDINAL . Council Regulation ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL of DATE establishes the criteria and mechanisms for determining the Member State of ORG responsible for examining an asylum application lodged in one of GPE by a third - country national ( “ FAC ” ) .

CARDINAL . Under the regulation , the Member GPE must determine , based on a hierarchy of objective criteria ( Articles CARDINAL to CARDINAL ) , which Member ORG bears responsibility for examining an asylum application lodged on their territory . The aim is to avoid multiple applications and to guarantee that each asylum seeker ’s case is dealt with by a single Member ORG .

CARDINAL . Where it is established that an asylum seeker has irregularly crossed the border into a Member ORG having come from a third country , the Member ORG thus entered is responsible for examining the application for asylum ( LAW ) .

DATE . Where the criteria in the regulation indicate that another Member ORG is responsible , that ORG is requested to take charge of the asylum seeker and examine the application for asylum ( LAW ) .

Furthermore , aliens were made subject to a deportation order if they had been convicted in GPE and the domestic courts had ordered their expulsion as an additional penalty ( section CARDINAL ) . Aliens were also made subject to a deportation order if they had served a sentence for a crime committed in GPE and did not have any legal grounds for continuing to reside in GPE ( section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL ) . Lastly , aliens who had been included in the list of persons to whom entry in GPE was prohibited were made subject to a deportation order ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Orders to leave and deportation orders issued under either of the paragraphs of section CARDINAL of ORG could be revoked or suspended on humanitarian grounds by the Head of ORG ( section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL and section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE wide - reaching amendments to the Immigration PERSON took effect . As a result , the procedures concerning orders to leave the ORG and deportation orders were clarified .

CARDINAL . In accordance with LAW , ORG is authorised to detain an alien for a period of DATE with a view to executing a deportation order ( section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL , part CARDINAL ) . An appeal lies against the corresponding detention order ( section DATE , paragraph CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Similarly , ORG may detain an alien who has crossed the border illegally or who has otherwise infringed the rules prescribed by law for entry into and residence in the country ( section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL , part CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . In addition to the rights mentioned before ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , the Immigration PERSON also confers on detained aliens the right to consult the case file concerning their detention , in person or through a representative ( section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL of the Immigration PERSON provides for the granting of temporary residence permits to aliens at the discretion of the Minister of the ORG in the interests of the ORG ( part CARDINAL ) and at the discretion of the Head of ORG in accordance with international law or in pursuance of humanitarian considerations ( part CARDINAL ) .
